title: Two Pointers Pattern
description: Master the two pointers technique for solving array problems efficiently. Learn when and how to use this pattern.

title: Sliding Window Pattern
description: Learn the sliding window technique for substring and subarray problems with optimal time complexity.

title: Dynamic Programming: Memoization and Tabulation
description: Understand DP fundamentals, recursive solutions, memoization, and bottom-up tabulation approach.

title: Backtracking: Exploring All Possibilities
description: Learn backtracking for permutations, combinations, and constraint satisfaction problems.

title: Depth-First Search (DFS) and Traversal
description: Master DFS for graphs and trees, iterative and recursive implementations, and common applications.

title: Breadth-First Search (BFS) and Level-Order Traversal
description: Learn BFS for shortest path, level-order traversal, and queue-based exploration techniques.

title: Binary Search and Search Variations
description: Master binary search, search boundaries, and variations like searching in rotated arrays.

title: Greedy Algorithms: Making Optimal Local Choices
description: Learn greedy approach, when it works, and problems where greedy provides optimal solutions.

title: Union-Find (Disjoint Set Union) Data Structure
description: Understand union-find for cycle detection, connected components, and graph connectivity problems.

title: Topological Sorting: Dependency Resolution
description: Learn topological sorting using DFS and Kahn's algorithm for directed acyclic graphs.

title: Array Fundamentals: Creation and Access
description: Understand array creation, indexing, length property, and accessing elements. Learn zero-based indexing and boundary conditions.

title: Array Traversal Techniques
description: Master different ways to iterate arrays: for loops, forEach, for...of, while loops. Understand when to use each approach.

title: Array Transformation Methods: map, filter, reduce
description: Learn functional array methods for transforming data. Master map for transformation, filter for selection, reduce for aggregation.

title: Array Mutating Methods: push, pop, shift, unshift, splice
description: Understand methods that modify original arrays. Learn stack operations (push/pop), queue operations (shift/unshift), and splice for complex modifications.

title: Array Searching: indexOf, find, findIndex, includes
description: Master searching techniques in arrays. Learn linear search methods and when to use each one.

title: Array Sorting and Comparison
description: Learn sort() method, custom comparator functions, and stable sorting. Understand sorting numbers, strings, and objects.

title: Multi-dimensional Arrays and Matrices
description: Work with 2D arrays, nested loops for matrix traversal, and common matrix operations.

title: Common Array Patterns: Prefix Sum, Frequency Counter
description: Master frequently used array patterns like prefix sums, running sums, frequency counting with objects/maps.

title: In-Place Array Manipulation
description: Learn to modify arrays without extra space. Master two-pointer techniques for reversing, removing duplicates, and rearranging elements.

title: Subarray Problems and Techniques
description: Understand contiguous subarrays, maximum subarray problems, subarray sum techniques, and sliding window applications.

title: String Fundamentals and Immutability
description: Understand string creation, immutability concept, indexing, and length property. Learn why strings can't be modified in-place.

title: Basic String Methods: charAt, slice, substring, substr
description: Master methods for accessing and extracting string portions. Learn differences between slice, substring, and substr.

title: String Searching: indexOf, includes, startsWith, endsWith
description: Learn methods for finding substrings and patterns. Master includes for existence checks and indexOf for position finding.

title: String Transformation: Case and Whitespace
description: Master toUpperCase, toLowerCase, trim, trimStart, trimEnd. Learn case-insensitive comparisons and whitespace handling.

title: String-Array Conversion: split and join
description: Learn to convert strings to arrays with split() and arrays to strings with join(). Understand delimiter usage and common patterns.

title: Template Literals and String Interpolation
description: Master template literals for string composition, multi-line strings, and expression embedding. Learn tagged templates.

title: String Replacement: replace and replaceAll
description: Learn replace() for single replacements and replaceAll() for multiple replacements. Understand regex usage in replacements.

title: Regular Expressions Basics for String Matching
description: Introduction to regex for pattern matching. Learn match(), test(), search() methods and basic regex patterns.

title: Character Manipulation: charCodeAt, fromCharCode
description: Work with character codes for comparisons and transformations. Learn ASCII/Unicode basics and character arithmetic.

title: Common String Patterns: Palindrome, Anagram, Reversal
description: Master frequently asked string problems: checking palindromes, detecting anagrams, reversing strings, and character frequency counting.

title: Object Fundamentals: Creation and Properties
description: Understand object creation (literal, constructor, Object.create), property access (dot vs bracket notation), and dynamic property names.

title: Object Methods and this Context
description: Learn to add methods to objects, understand 'this' keyword, method shorthand syntax, and arrow functions in objects.

title: Object Static Methods: keys, values, entries
description: Master Object.keys(), Object.values(), Object.entries() for extracting data. Learn to convert objects to arrays and iterate efficiently.

title: Object Iteration: for...in and Modern Approaches
description: Learn to iterate objects using for...in, Object.keys with forEach, and Object.entries with for...of. Understand enumerable properties.

title: Object Destructuring and Rest/Spread
description: Master destructuring for extracting properties, default values, renaming, nested destructuring, and rest/spread operators for objects.

title: Object Copying: Shallow vs Deep Clone
description: Understand shallow copy (Object.assign, spread), deep copy techniques (JSON.parse/stringify, structuredClone), and reference vs value.

title: Property Existence and hasOwnProperty
description: Learn to check property existence with 'in' operator, hasOwnProperty(), and Object.hasOwn(). Understand prototype chain implications.

title: Object Merging and Assignment
description: Master Object.assign() and spread operator for merging objects. Understand property overwriting and creating composite objects.

title: Computed Property Names and Dynamic Keys
description: Learn to use expressions as property keys, create objects with dynamic properties, and use bracket notation for runtime key generation.

title: Objects as Hash Maps: Frequency Counters and Lookups
description: Use objects for O(1) lookups, frequency counting, grouping data, and caching. Learn when to use objects vs Map for hash table patterns.
